form_title.ms_form_title_llm_v1: United States Department of Justice Immigration and Naturalization Service, Form 9-132

full_text: Form 9-132-St. Paul 9-19-47 UNITED STATES DEPARTMENT OF JUSTICE Immigration and Naturalization Service 1014 New Post Office Building Saint Paul 1, Minnesota July 8. 1952 File No. A 6 699 884 Mr. Maoling Liu 5597 630 Lincoln Street N. E. Minneapolis 13, Minnesota ,1g Dear Sir or Madam: The records of this Service show that the time for which you were admitted to the United States temporarily as a non-quota student will expire August 7. 1952 If you intend to continue your studies beyond that period, the enclosed application for extension of stay (Form I-535) in duplicate, should be completed in every detail, after which you should bring it personally to Room 1014, New Post Office Building, St. Paul, Minnesota, any week day except Saturday or a holiday between 8:30 a.m. and 3:30 p.m. You should also bring the record of admission which you received at the time of entry (Form I-94), and passport or other travel document valid at least sixty days beyond the date to which you seek an extension. If you have completed your studies or expect to do so before the period of your present stay expires and you plan to leave the United States, it is requested that this letter be delivered to an officer of the Immigration and Naturalization Service at the port of departure. Very truly yours, Irvin F. Shrode Officer in Charge By: D. Perfetto Assistant Officer in Charge PS: The attached application, if submitted, must also be accompanied by a letter from your school giving the estimated date of your gradua- tion and the type of degree to be awarded.
